{{champion:136}} 

He could go through the life cycle of a star, and depending on how much matter you consumed (i.e., cosmetic pickups, like Lux), you'd have different results. 

He would start, like most stars do, as a stellar nebula, full of color and light, but very wispy, with very little structure to his body. From there, he'd collect matter and develop into either an average star (like ours) or a supergiant. 

The average star would be bright and yellow, with arcs of flame and solar energy. Perhaps grass would grow around him as he moved to represent the life-giving warmth of our star. 

The supergiant would be buff and red/blue, scorching the land around it. 

As the average star form collected more matter, it would break down into a planetary nebula. Very similar to the original form, but with the glowing halo of light and gas around him, and a different scheme of colors. There'd be more structure and form to him. After that, he'd become a white dwarf, regal and divine-looking. 

The supergiant for would get brighter and brighter until it went supernova, collapsing into a black hole. The black hole form would be very dark and sinister looking, perhaps even consuming minions and players he kills.
As long as it's something ***original*** and not for one of the absurdly popular champions, I don't care! But if you had to make me choose one, Viktor maybe?

It's a near complete waste of the time, manpower, and other resources sunk into a $30 skin if it's not for a champion who can sell it. If they made it for someone with fringe unpopularity like Viktor, that's not a sound investment for them. There's a reason WHY Lux, Ezreal, Sona, Miss Fortune, and Udyr were selected for ultimate skins. At the time their skins were made, all of the champions were insanely popular.
So it will be for an absurdly popular champion, do not convince yourself that there is even a possibility of anything else.

I don't know, while there was definitely more or less popular champions, Sona and Udyr were not extra mega popular like Ezreal, Miss Fortune and Lux from those times. From what I remember that is. I just don't want some champions to get every content possible and some left to dust forever.

Sona was INSANELY popular when DJ came out, and she was a consistent favorite for many years, and still is. I confess, I was not around when Udyr's skin came out, but my friends who were tell me that he was also consistently popular around that time.

Either way, hoping that low popularity champions get an ultimate skin is like trying to shoot an arrow at a target in the forest in the pitch of night with no moon. There's a very tiny chance it could happen, but the odds are, you're going to hit one of the massive trees before you hit your little target.

Skins have to sell to be worth the time (e.g. salaries) of the programmers, animators, modelers, SFX and VFX artists, voice actors, and whatever else goes into them. This is especially true for ultimate skins, since the scope on them is gigantic. They're not going to take a risk with their most expensive product line on a champion who statistically isn't played often or doesn't sell skins as it is. It's a foolish investment for any business.
